Package tools.concurrent

Class ThreadTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.concurrent.ThreadTimer
  • public class ThreadTimer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which replaces the Timer class. The added functionalities are:
    • Changing the update interval. Keeps the same task running. Can be set via interval or updates per second (fps).
    • Pausing a timer. A paused timer will, after being resumed, continue as if it wasn't paused. So if the next update is over 500ms before being paused, then after being resumed the next update will occur over 500ms. If the update interval was decreased with dt while the timer was paused, then the next update will occur over max(0, 500-dt).
    • Canceling a timer. After a timer has been canceled, it can be started again with the same settings.
    • Manual and automatic frame rate handeling. In manual mode, a target interval is set and the updates occur after every interval time. If the previous update was still running, then the current update is ignored.
      In automatic mode, a target interval is set and AIMD is used to prevent clashing update cycles.
    • Starting a timer which is already started does nothing.
    • Resuming a timer which is already started or canceled does nothing.
    • Pausing a timer which is already paused or canceled does nothing.
    • Canceling a timer which is already canceled does nothing.
    This class is thread safe.

      • waitMul

        public int waitMul
        Keeps track of how many cycles must pass before the additative increase is replaced by multiplicative increase.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThreadTimer

        public ThreadTimer​(long interval,
                   java.lang.Runnable... rs)
        Creates a new timer which uses a separate thread to execute the given functions once every interval.
        Parameters:
        interval - The time in ms which is between two executions of the tasks.
        rs - The tasks that will be executed on every interval.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If interval <= 0.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If rs == null.
        See Also:
        ThreadTimer(long, long, Scheduler, Runnable...)

      • ThreadTimer

        public ThreadTimer​(long delay,
                   long interval,
                   java.lang.Runnable... rs)
        Creates a new timer which uses a separate thread to execute the given functions once every interval. After starting, first waits until the initial delay has past.
        Parameters:
        delay - The time in ms before the first exectution of the tasks.
        interval - The time in ms which is between two executions of the tasks.
        rs - The tasks that will be executed on every interval.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If interval <= 0 or delay <= 0.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If rs == null.
        See Also:
        ThreadTimer(long, long, Scheduler, Runnable...)

      • ThreadTimer

        public ThreadTimer​(long interval,
                   Scheduler sched,
                   java.lang.Runnable... rs)
        Creates a new timer which uses a separate thread to execute the given functions once every interval on the given scheduler.
        Parameters:
        interval - The time in ms which is between two executions of the tasks.
        sched - The scheduler used for scheduling tasks. If null, then SelfScheduler is used as default.
        rs - The tasks that will be executed on every interval.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If interval <= 0.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If rs == null.
        See Also:
        ThreadTimer(long, long, Scheduler, Runnable...)

      • ThreadTimer

        public ThreadTimer​(long delay,
                   long interval,
                   Scheduler sched,
                   java.lang.Runnable... rs)
        Creates a new timer which uses a separate thread to execute the given functions once every interval on the given scheduler. After starting, first waits until the initial delay has past.
        Parameters:
        delay - The time in ms before the first exectution of the tasks.
        interval - The time in ms which is between two executions of the tasks.
        sched - The scheduler used for scheduling tasks. If null, then SelfScheduler is used as default.
        rs - The tasks that will be executed on every interval.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If interval <= 0 or delay <= 0.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If rs == null.

      • setTargetInterval

        public void setTargetInterval​(long interval)
        Sets the target interval. When using the auto-fps mode, this value will be used even when a shorter interval is possible. Also sets the current interval to the target interval to improve convergence.
        Blocks until
        Parameters:
        interval - the new target interval.

        Sets the target frame rate.
        Parameters:
        fps - the new target frame rate.
